alert.note: Alert for Hawaii in Hawaii (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 21 at 4:17PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM HST THIS EVENING FOR THE ISLAND OF HAWAII IN HAWAII COUNTY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...The island of Hawaii in Hawaii County. * WHEN...Until 730 PM HST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding on roads, poor drainage areas, and in streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 415 PM HST, radar indicated spotty heavy showers continuing to fall over leeward and interior Big Island at rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour. Additonal heavy showers are expected through the afternoon. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Kailua-Kona, Captain Cook, Waikoloa Village, Honalo, Holualoa, Kainaliu, Kealakekua, Kahaluu-Keauhou, Honaunau, Pohakuloa Training Area, Puuanahulu, Kalaoa, Pohakuloa Camp, Puako, Hawaiian Ocean View, Kona International Airport, Waikii, Waikoloa Beach, Mauna Lani and Milolii. This advisory may need to be extended beyond 730 PM HST if flooding persists.
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, drainage ditches and low lying areas prone to flooding.
